snippet: Mass executions of civilians and of fighters who were no longer participating in hostilities were reported in the northern cities of Aleppo, Idlib and Raqqa.
abstract: United Nations human rights chief Navi Pillay says series of mass executions attributed to jihadist rebels in Syria may constitute war crimes and crimes against humanity.
lead_paragraph: Mass executions of civilians and of fighters who were no longer participating in hostilities were reported in the northern cities of Aleppo, Idlib and Raqqa.

headline.main: U.N. Says Executions in Syria by Rebels May Be War Crimes
headline.print_headline: U.N. Says Executions in Syria by Rebels May Be War Crimes
